function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Embedding contextual information in 3D building models may lead to inaccurate simulation of occupant behaviors and interactions.","Impact":"Misleading design analysis and planning, potential for gaps between design and use phases.","Mitigation":"Conduct thorough validation and verification of simulated behaviors with real-world data, involve experts in human behavior and building design in the simulation process.","Technologies":"Advanced data analytics and machine learning algorithms for behavior modeling, real-time data integration for validation and verification.","People":"Building designers, architects, urban planners, occupant behavior experts.","Owner":"Building design firms, technology companies, research institutions."},{"Description":"Lack of trust in virtual human agency and simulated human behaviors may result in skepticism and resistance to using the system for evaluating designs.","Impact":"Undermined credibility of simulation results, reluctance to adopt new technology for design evaluation.","Mitigation":"Invest in transparency and education about the accuracy and reliability of the simulation system, conduct user training and awareness programs.","Technologies":"Interactive visualization tools, user-friendly interfaces for behavior parameter adjustment, educational resources for building occupants and design professionals.","People":"Architects, designers, building occupants, technology developers.","Owner":"Building design firms, technology companies, educational institutions."},{"Description":"Difficulty in manually adjusting behavior-generating parameters for simulations with many occupants may lead to inefficiency and potential errors.","Impact":"Reduced simulation accuracy, increased workload for users, potential for overlooking critical behavioral patterns.","Mitigation":"Implement data-driven approach for behavior modeling, automate behavior parameter adjustment based on real occupancy data, optimize user interface and system performance.","Technologies":"Machine learning algorithms for data-driven behavior modeling, automation tools for behavior parameter adjustment, user-friendly interfaces for automation control.","People":"Simulation analysts, building designers, architects, system developers.","Owner":"Technology companies, research institutions, building design firms."}]}
